title: George Rogers Clark National Historical Park: Park Fun
body: Park Fun         Prospective Junior Rangers hard at work on their activity sheet. National Park Service  Summer Junior Ranger Series Every summer, George Rogers Clark NHP hosts a series of events called the "Summer Junior Ranger Series."  This is a series of events, one every month, over the course of the summer. Every event has a different theme- such as, "Learn to be a Frontiersman Day," or "Archaeology Day."  For every event a child attends, they will earn a certificate. For the first event a child attends, they will also receive a National Park pen and pencil set. For the second event a child attends, they will receive a special Junior Ranger badge. For the third event a child attends, they will receive a unique Summer Junior Ranger Series T-shirt! These events are free and open to the public. These events always have a wide variety of activities, so children of all ages will find something to enjoy! Be on the lookout for the 2015 Summer Junior Ranger Series schedule! Also, feel free to call the park at 812-882-1776 to ask for more details.
